subject: Career
title: Connectors, Mavens, and Salesmen
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Connectors, Mavens, and Salesmen.

hook.text: Some people seem to know everyone. Malcolm Gladwell calls them Connectors.

buildup.text: In 'The Tipping Point,' Gladwell identifies three social roles: Connectors, Mavens, and Salesmen.

discovery.text: Connectors link groups. Mavens gather and share knowledge. Salesmen persuade people to act.

twist.text: You don't have to be all three. But knowing one of each in your network multiplies your reach.

climax.text: Identify which role comes naturally to you and lean into it. Then befriend the other types.

punchline.text: Know who connects, who knows, and who convinces.

quiz.question: What are Gladwell's three social roles in The Tipping Point?
